Question: Navigation Instruction given at initial position: [take off and turn slightly right and then turn slightly left towards a brown building. fly forward and turn right towards a white building when above an intersection. fly forward and land in front of a light pole.]. You move according to a series of movement instructions. What are you doing now?  
choose:  
A. I fly forward and land in front of the light pole.  
B. When above the road, I fly forward towards the white building.  
C. I take off and turn slightly to the right, then slightly to the left, toward a brown building.  
D. I turn back.  
E. I fly forward.

textgrad_result.init_answer: Option: B; Reason: The agent is currently above the road and moving forward towards a white building, which aligns with the instruction to "fly forward towards the white building when above an intersection." The presence of the intersection and the direction towards the white building in the frames supports this choice.

This directly corresponds to the instruction "fly forward and turn right towards a white building when above an intersection." Therefore, option B accurately describes the agent's current action.
